Just finished watching the local early morning news. Another woman was killed yesterday close to my home, she was widowed only two months ago . A man enters her home and rapes her , then slits her throat. I understand that women are generally the weaker sex, in physical strength. I know that most crimes committed by men against women , are quick , and a lot of them without much warning . But what I dont understand, is why SO MANY crimes against women continue to happen in such quantity ? When are women going to instill and BURN in their minds, THEY are a easy prey, a target, a target of deranged males, males that come in all shapes and dress, educational levels, and social status ?? ...
 
 
 When are they going to burn it in to their minds, that the system made up of the police and manmade laws CANNOT protect them . Laws are for prevention , the police are usually put on the scene AFTER the crime is committed. It is only until women become constantly aware of their environment , learn how to "read" a situation for "signs" of what it may become, and hold within them at least a miniscule distrust for males, will they have at least some defense against this horrific trend in our society. jmo, and end of rant, :(

 I actually see your point. My wife carries a commander length .45 and knows how to use it, and HAS used it on at least one occasion. My wife grew up in the country and was totally lacking any kind of critical awareness when we met. She just naturally assumed the best about everybody. It actually took her getting attacked before she was willing to do anything to safeguard herself.
 
 My mother and sister both worked at childrens mervy hosptial in kansas city for years. Childrens is in one of the worst parts of town. Shootouts in the parking garage are not that uncommon. for years my father tried to talk them into carrying a weapon, but both refused (though my sister did carry a can of mace, he was hoping for somthing a little more extreme). One night while leaving the hospital after a 15 hour shift, my sister got to her car to find it riddled with bullet holes. She went the next day and bought her own gun and took lessons in how to use it.
 
 It seems to me that part fo the problem is that women od not want to take responsibility for their own safety, or they fail to take drastic enough measures. I remember my mom and sistewr telling me about the self defense calsses that the KCMO police department provided where they taught you such worthless things as "your car keys are an excellent weapon" or "pepper spray cna be more effective than a gun" what a crock.

The problem with any weapon you may keep is that if you lose control of it - it could be used against you. This can especially be a concern for women who can more easily be overpowered by most men.
 
 For the record I don't begrudge gun-owning at all. It's just something to bear in mind when deciding on carrying a weapon.

 
 This is just a matter of training, common sense, and willingness to do more than wave your weapon around. 
 
 The first thing any competent self defens einstructor should teach you is to NEVER, EVER allow your adversary to get close enough to grab your weapon. The second should be that if they ARE close enough to grab your weapon, you should have laready shot them before they realise you even have a gun. While pulling your weapon and holding people at gunpoint looks great on TV or in the movies, and is a fine idea for police officers who have backup either directly at hand or on the way, it is an incredibly poor idea for a lone victim, especially in the even that the victim is a woman who is physically overmatched by their attacker.
 
 If the situation has deteriorated enough to pull your weapon, it is bad enough to use it without warning. Make sure you kill the guy, even if it means shooting him twice, and there is nobody to testify against you.
 
 When my wife used her gun, she never even got it out of her purse. She grabbed it and fired through her purse and hit the guy in the chest and, as I had taught her, pulled the trigger 7 times, then put in a fresh clip.
 
 Better to be tried by 12 than carried off by six, and when you are talking a lone woman facing an agressive attacker, especially a male attacker, you would be hard pressed to find a prosecutor willing to put that in front of a jury.

Okay, my computer is too slow to go search some statistics and copy the url to try and defend my opinion; but, here is my opinion anyway.
 
 One reason there are so many crimes against women, or crimes in general, is that offenders are repeat offenders much of the time. How many times have you heard of a child molester being released from prison and repeating the crime? There is not much determent to crime when criminals are put in jail for a year and on their first parole hearing are released back on the street to repeat offenses.
 
 I don't know what the answer is --but I think that is the reason there are so many crimes, especially sex crimes.
